explanation: The stage direction describes the setting of the scene, including the location and objects present. It sets the stage for the action that will follow, specifically mentioning the boudoir of the Comtesse and the presence of a small screen. This falls under the 'setting' category.
stgdir: La scène représente le boudoir de la Comtesse. À gauche, un petit paravent. Au lever du rideau, la Comtesse de La Roche-Gaston est seule en scène.
